VSE QUICK FUNCTIONS
VSEQuickFunctions-0_88.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 #VSE Quick Functions
2 #
3 #
4 #Features that this script includes:
5 #
6 #Quickfades -
7 # Can be found in the sequence editor properties panel, or by pressing the
8 # 'f' key over the sequencer.
9 # Fade Length - The target length for fade editing or creating.
10 # Set Fadein/Set Fadeout - Allows easy adding, detecting and changing of
11 # fade in/out. The script will check the curve for any fades already
12 # applied to the clip (either manually or by the script), and edit them
13 # if found. Can apply the same fade to multiple clips at once.
14 # Transition Type - Selects the type of transition for adding.
15 # Crossfade Prev/Next Clip - Allows easy adding of transitions between clips.
16 # Will simply find an overlapping clip from the active clip and add
17 # a transition.
18 # Smart Cross to Prev/Next - Adjust the length of the active clip and the
19 # next clip to create a transition of the target fade length. Will also
20 # attempt to avoid extending the clips past their end points if possible.
21 #
22 #Quicksnaps -
23 # Can be found in the sequence editor 'Strip' menu, or by pressing the
24 # 's' key over the sequencer.
25 # Allows quickly snapping clips to each other or moving the cursor to clips.
26 # Cursor To Nearest Second - Will round the cursor position to the nearest
27 # second, based on framerate.
28 # Cursor To Beginning/End Of Clip - Will move the cursor to the beginning or
29 # end of the active clip.
30 # Clip Beginning/End To Cursor - Moves all selected clips so their
31 # beginning/end is at the cursor.
32 # Clip To Previous/Next Clip - Detects the previous or next clip in the
33 # timeline from the active clip. Moves the active clip so it's beginning
34 # or end matches the previous clip's end or beginning.
35 #
36 #Quickzooms -
37 # Can be found in the sequence editor 'View' menu, or by pressing the
38 # 'z' key over the sequencer.
39 # Zoom All - Zooms the sequencer out to show all clips.
40 # Zoom Selected - Zooms the sequencer to show the currently selected clip(s).
41 # Zoom Cursor - Zooms the sequencer to an amount of frames around the cursor.
42 # Size - How many frames should be shown by using Zoom Cursor.
43 # Changing this value will automatically activate Zoom Cursor.
44 #
45 #Quickparents -
46 # Can be found in the sequence editor properties panel, or by pressing the
47 # 'Ctrl-p' key over the sequencer.
48 # This implements a parenting system for sequencer clips, allowing easy
49 # selecting of multiple related clips. Note that any relationships will
50 # be broken if a clip is renamed!
51 # Select Children - Selects any child clips found for the currently selected
52 # clip(s). Also can be accomplished with the shortcut 'Shift-p'
53 # Set Active As Parent - If multiple clips are selected, this will set
54 # selected clips as children of the active (lastly selected) clip.
55 # Clear Parent - Removes parent relationships from selected children clips.
56 # Clear Children - Removes child relationships from selected parent clips.
57 # Children or Parents of selected clip will be shown at the bottom of
58 # the Panel/Menu.
59 #
60 #Quickcontinuous -
61 # Settings can be found in the sequence editor 'View' menu.
62 # When Quickcontinuous is enabled, it will constantly run and detect clip
63 # editing events.
64 # Cursor Following - Automatically moves the sequencer timeline to try and
65 # follow the cursor. Unfortunately, this can be fooled if the cursor is
66 # offscreen, or if the cursor is moved a large amount.
67 # Clip Auto Snapping - If a clip is grabbed and placed, the closest clip will
68 # be found, if this clip is within the snapping distance, the dropped
69 # clip will be snapped to the closest clip.
70 # Cut/Move Clip Children - Works with Quickparents by finding any children
71 # of a moved or cut clip and performing the same operation on them.
72 # If the clip is cut, any children under the cursor will be cut as well,
73 # and the script will attempt to duplicate parent/child relationships to
74 # the cut clips. Note, if you cut a clip with the mouse on the left
75 # side of the cursor this will not work because the cut parent isnt
76 # selected (so keep the mouse on the right side of the cursor).
77 #
78 #Quicktitling -
79 # Can be found in the sequence editor properties panel.
80 # This will create and edit simple scenes for title overlays.
81 # Create Title Scene - This will create a title scene with the settings
82 # shown below.
83 # Update Title Scene - If an already-created title scene is selected,
84 # this will apply the current settings to that scene.
85 # Scene Length - The length in frames of the title scene.
86 # Text Font - A menu of the currently loaded fonts in the blend file.
87 # Text Material - A menu of all materials in the blend file.
88 # Text X/Y Location - Determines the center point of the text with 0,0 being
89 # the center of the screen.
90 # Text Size - Scale of the text.
91 # Extrude - Amount of extrusion to create a 3D look.
92 # Bevel Size - Amount of beveling to apply to the text.
93 # Bevel Resolution - Subdivisions of the bevel.
94 # Text - Title text.
95 # Shadow Amount - Determines the opacity of the drop shadow.
96 # Distance - How far away the shadow plane is from the text object, larger
97 # values result in a larger shadow
98 # Soft - The amount of blur applied to the drop shadow.
99 #
100 #Quicklist -
101 # Can be found in the sequence editor properties panel.
102 # Displays a list of loaded clips and allows you to change various settings.
103 # Sort by - Reorders the list based on timeline position, title, or length.
104 # Eye Icon - Mutes/unmutes clip.
105 # Padlock Icon - Locks/unlocks clip.
106 # Clip Type Button - Allows selecting and deselecting clip.
107 # Clip Title - Allows editing of clip name.
108 # Length/Position - Move or resize the clip.
109 # Proxy settings - Enable/disable proxy and sizes.
110 #
111 #
112 #Todo:
113 # fix:
114 # parent/child relationship copy info not showing
115 # detecting cut clips isn't currently possible when the first clip isnt selected after the cut
116 # fades get really screwed up when the in/out points of a clip are changed after fade is added
117 # cursor following is pretty buggy
118 # continuous mode may stop working and need to be disabled and re-enabled
119 # add:
120 # add functions for quicklist - swap clip with previous or next if in position sort
121 # make quicklist more streamlined, maybe put it in a modal dialog

141 #Functions used by various features
142 def find_next_clip(sequences, clip, mode='overlap'):
143  #if mode is overlap, will only return overlapping sequences
144  #if mode is channel, will only return sequences in clip's channel
145  #if mode is set to other, all clips are considered
146  overlaps = []
147  nexts = []
148  for sequence in sequences:
149  if (sequence.type != 'SOUND'):
150  if (mode == 'channel'):
151  if ((clip.frame_final_end <= sequence.frame_final_start) & (clip.channel == sequence.channel)):
152  nexts.append(sequence)
153  else:
154  #if clip's end point overlaps the sequence, and the sequence begins after the clip
155  if ((clip.frame_final_end > sequence.frame_final_start) & (clip.frame_final_end < sequence.frame_final_end) & (clip.frame_final_start < sequence.frame_final_start)):
156  overlaps.append(sequence)
157  if (mode != 'overlap'):
158  if (clip.frame_final_end == sequence.frame_final_start):
159  overlaps.append(sequence)
160  if (clip.frame_final_end <= sequence.frame_final_start):
161  nexts.append(sequence)
162  if (len(overlaps) > 0):
163  return min(overlaps, key=lambda overlap: abs(overlap.channel - clip.channel))
164  elif ((mode != 'overlap') & (len(nexts) > 0)):
165  return min(nexts, key=lambda next: (next.frame_final_start - clip.frame_final_end))
166  else:
167  return False
168 
169 def find_previous_clip(sequences, clip, mode='overlap'):
170  overlaps = []
171  previous = []
172  for sequence in sequences:
173  if (mode == 'channel'):
174  if ((clip.frame_final_start >= sequence.frame_final_end) & (clip.channel == sequence.channel)):
175  previous.append(sequence)
176  else:
177  if ((clip.frame_final_start > sequence.frame_final_start) & (clip.frame_final_start < sequence.frame_final_end) & (clip.frame_final_end > sequence.frame_final_end)):
178  overlaps.append(sequence)
179  if (mode != 'overlap'):
180  if (clip.frame_final_start == sequence.frame_final_end):
181  overlaps.append(sequence)
182  if (clip.frame_final_start >= sequence.frame_final_end):
183  previous.append(sequence)
184  if (len(overlaps) > 0):
185  return min(overlaps, key=lambda overlap: abs(overlap.channel - clip.channel))
186  elif ((mode != 'overlap') & (len(previous) > 0)):
187  return min(previous, key=lambda prev: (clip.frame_final_start - prev.frame_final_end))
188  else:
189  return False
190 
191 def timecode_from_frames(frame, framespersecond, levels=0, subsecondtype='miliseconds'):
192  if (levels > 4):
193  levels = 4
194  if (subsecondtype == 'frames'):
195  subseconddivisor = framespersecond
196  else:
197  subseconddivisor = 100
198  totalhours = math.modf(frame/framespersecond/60/60)
199  totalminutes = math.modf(totalhours[0] * 60)
200  remainingseconds = math.modf(totalminutes[0] * 60)
201  hours = int(totalhours[1])
202  minutes = int(totalminutes[1])
203  seconds = int(remainingseconds[1])
204  subseconds = int(remainingseconds[0] * subseconddivisor)
205  time = str(hours).zfill(2)+':'+str(minutes).zfill(2)+':'+str(seconds).zfill(2)+':'+str(subseconds).zfill(2)[-2:]
206  if (levels == 0):
207  while (time[0:3] == '00:'):
208  time = time[3:len(time)]
209  return time
210  else:
211  return time.split(':', 4 - levels)[-1]

219 def find_sound_clip(clipname, clips):
220  soundclip = None
221  os.path.splitext(clipname)[0]
222  for clip in clips:
223  if ((os.path.splitext(clip.name)[0] == os.path.splitext(clipname)[0]) & (clip.type == 'SOUND')):
224  return clip

231 #Functions related to QuickTitling
232 def titling_scene():
233  sequence = bpy.context.scene.sequence_editor.active_strip
234  if (sequence == None):
235  scene = bpy.context.scene
236  elif (('QuickTitle: ' in sequence.name) & (sequence.type == 'SCENE')):
237  scene = sequence.scene
238  else:
239  scene = bpy.context.scene
240  return scene

243 #Functions related to QuickSpeed
244 @persistent
245 def frame_step(scene):
246  scene = bpy.context.scene
247  step = scene.step
248  if (step == 1):
249  if (scene.frame_current % 3 == 0):
250  scene.frame_current = scene.frame_current + 1
251  if (step > 1):
252  scene.frame_current = scene.frame_current + (step - 1)

257  self.layout_width = 30
258  layout.prop(scene, 'step', text="Speed Step")

266 def zoom_custom(begin, end):
267  scene = bpy.context.scene
268  selected = []
269  try:
270  sequences = bpy.context.sequences
271  except:
272  scene.sequence_editor_create()
273  sequences = bpy.context.sequences
274  for sequence in sequences:
275  if (sequence.select):
276  selected.append(sequence)
277  sequence.select = False
278  zoomClip = scene.sequence_editor.sequences.new_effect(name='temp', type='ADJUSTMENT', channel=1, frame_start=begin, frame_end=end)
279  active = bpy.context.scene.sequence_editor.active_strip
280  scene.sequence_editor.active_strip = zoomClip
281  for region in bpy.context.area.regions:
282  if (region.type == 'WINDOW'):
283  override = {'region': region, 'window': bpy.context.window, 'screen': bpy.context.screen, 'area': bpy.context.area, 'scene': bpy.context.scene}
284  bpy.ops.sequencer.view_selected(override)
285  scene.sequence_editor.sequences.remove(zoomClip)
286  for sequence in selected:
287  sequence.select = True
288  bpy.context.scene.sequence_editor.active_strip = active
289 
290 def zoom_cursor(self=None, context=None):
291  cursor = bpy.context.scene.frame_current
292  zoom_custom(cursor, (cursor + bpy.context.scene.zoom))

295 #Functions related to QuickFades
296 def crossfade(firstClip, secondClip):
297  type = bpy.context.scene.transition
298  sequences = bpy.context.sequences
299  bpy.ops.sequencer.select_all(action='DESELECT')
300  firstClip.select = True
301  secondClip.select = True
302  bpy.context.scene.sequence_editor.active_strip = secondClip
303  bpy.ops.sequencer.effect_strip_add(type=type)
304 
305 def fades(strip, fade, type, mode):
306  #strip = vse strip
307  #fade = positive value of fade in frames
308  #type = 'in' or 'out'
309  #mode = 'detect' or 'set' or 'clear'
310  scene = bpy.context.scene
311  #these functions check for the needed variables and create them if in set mode. Otherwise, ends the function.
312  if (scene.animation_data == None):
313  #no animation data in scene, create it
314  if (mode == 'set'):
315  scene.animation_data_create()
316  else:
317  return 0
318  if (scene.animation_data.action == None):
319  #no action in scene, create it
320  if (mode == 'set'):
321  action = bpy.data.actions.new(scene.name+"Action")
322  scene.animation_data.action = action
323  else:
324  return 0
325  fcurves = scene.animation_data.action.fcurves
326  fadeZero = False
327  fadeFull = False
328  keyframes = False
329  if (strip.type == 'SOUND'):
330  fadeVariable = 'volume'
331  else:
332  fadeVariable = 'blend_alpha'
333  #attempts to find the fade keyframes
334  for curve in fcurves:
335  if (curve.data_path == 'sequence_editor.sequences_all["'+strip.name+'"].'+fadeVariable):
336  #keyframes found
337  fcurve = curve
338  if (mode == 'clear'):
339  fcurves.remove(curve)
340  return 0
341  keyframes = curve.keyframe_points
342  if (type == 'in'):
343  if (len(keyframes) > 0):
344  fadeZero = keyframes[0]
345  if (len(keyframes) > 1):
346  fadeFull = keyframes[1]
347  elif (type == 'out'):
348  if (len(keyframes) > 0):
349  fadeZero = keyframes[len(keyframes) - 1]
350  if (len(keyframes) > 1):
351  fadeFull = keyframes[len(keyframes) - 2]
352  if (keyframes == False):
353  #no keyframes found, create them if instructed to
354  if (mode == 'set'):
355  curve = fcurves.new(data_path=strip.path_from_id(fadeVariable))
356  keyframes = curve.keyframe_points
357  else:
358  return 0
359  alpha = 1
360  if (type == 'in'):
361  stripFadeEnd = strip.frame_final_start
362  elif (type == 'out'):
363  stripFadeEnd = strip.frame_final_end
364  fade = -fade
365  if (fadeZero):
366  #keyframes found, need to be adjusted
367  if (fadeZero.co[0] == stripFadeEnd):
368  if (fadeFull):
369  #start and end are present, start is where it needs to be
370  if (mode == 'set'):
371  if (fade != 0):
372  offset = ((stripFadeEnd + fade) - fadeFull.co[0])
373  fadeFull.co = (((fadeFull.co[0] + offset), alpha))
374  fadeFull.handle_left = ((fadeFull.handle_left[0] + offset, alpha))
375  fadeFull.handle_right = ((fadeFull.handle_right[0] + offset, alpha))
376  fadeZero.co = ((fadeZero.co[0], 0))
377  elif (fade == 0):
378  keyframes.remove(fadeZero)
379  else:
380  return abs(fadeFull.co[0] - fadeZero.co[0])
381  else:
382  #start is present and where it needs to be, no second, set alpha to start
383  if (mode == 'set'):
384  alpha = fadeZero.co[1]
385  fadeZero.co = ((fadeZero.co[0], 0))
386  keyframes.insert(frame=(stripFadeEnd + fade), value=alpha)
387  else:
388  return 0
389  else:
390  #no start and end where they need to be, but keyframe exists to set alpha
391  if (mode == 'set'):
392  #determine alpha from value at stripFadeEnd
393  alpha = fcurve.evaluate(stripFadeEnd)
394  #clear any keyframes before the beginning or after the end
395  index = len(keyframes) - 1
396  while index >= 0:
397  keyframe = keyframes[index]
398  if (type == 'in'):
399  if (keyframe.co[0] < stripFadeEnd):
400  keyframes.remove(keyframe)
401  elif (type == 'out'):
402  if (keyframe.co[0] > stripFadeEnd):
403  keyframes.remove(keyframe)
404  index = index - 1
405  keyframes.insert(frame=stripFadeEnd, value=0)
406  keyframes.insert(frame=(stripFadeEnd + fade), value=alpha)
407  else:
408  return 0
409  else:
410  #no keyframes found, create them
411  if (mode == 'set'):
412  alpha = getattr(strip, fadeVariable)
413  keyframes.insert(frame=stripFadeEnd, value=0)
414  keyframes.insert(frame=(stripFadeEnd + fade), value=alpha)
415  else:
416  return 0

419 #Functions related to QuickParents
420 def select_children(parent):
421  clean_relationships()
422  sequences = bpy.context.sequences
423  childrennames = find_children(parent)
424  for sequence in sequences:
425  if (sequence.name in childrennames):
426  sequence.select = True
427 
428 def add_children(parent, children):
429  clean_relationships()
430  for child in children:
431  if (child.name != parent.name):
432  children = parent.name
433  if (child.name not in children):
434  relationship = bpy.context.scene.parenting.add()
435  relationship.parent = parent.name
436  relationship.child = child.name
437 
438 def clear_children(parent):
439  clean_relationships()
440  if (type(parent) == str):
441  parentname = parent
442  else:
443  parentname = parent.name
444  scene = bpy.context.scene
445  index = 0
446  while index < len(scene.parenting):
447  if (scene.parenting[index].parent == parentname):
448  scene.parenting.remove(index)
449  else:
450  index = index + 1
451 
452 def clear_parent(child):
453  clean_relationships()
454  if (type(child) == str):
455  childname = child
456  else:
457  childname = child.name
458  scene = bpy.context.scene
459  for index, relationship in enumerate(scene.parenting):
460  if (relationship.child == childname):
461  scene.parenting.remove(index)
462 
463 def find_parent(child):
464  if (type(child) == str):
465  childname = child
466  else:
467  childname = child.name
468  scene = bpy.context.scene
469  for relationship in scene.parenting:
470  if (relationship.child == childname):
471  return relationship.parent
472  return "None"
473 
474 def find_children(parent):
475  if (type(parent) == str):
476  parentname = parent
477  else:
478  parentname = parent.name
479  scene = bpy.context.scene
480  childrennames = []
481  for relationship in scene.parenting:
482  if (relationship.parent == parentname):
483  childrennames.append(relationship.child)
484  return childrennames
485 
486 def clean_relationships():
487  scene = bpy.context.scene
488  sequences = scene.sequence_editor.sequences_all
489  for index, relationship in enumerate(scene.parenting):
490  if ( (sequences.find(relationship.parent) == -1) | (sequences.find(relationship.child) == -1) ):
491  scene.parenting.remove(index)

496  layout = self.layout
497  layout.menu('vseqf.quicksnaps_menu', text="Quick Snaps")

500 #Classes related to QuickList
501 class VSEQFQuickListPanel(bpy.types.Panel):
502  bl_label = "Quick List"
503  bl_space_type = 'SEQUENCE_EDITOR'
504  bl_region_type = 'UI'
505  @classmethod
506  def poll(self, context):
507  if (bpy.context.sequences):
508  if (len(bpy.context.sequences) > 0):
509  return True
510  else:
511  return False
512  else:
513  return False
514  def draw(self, contex):
515  layout = self.layout
516  scene = bpy.context.scene
517  sequencer = scene.sequence_editor
518  sequences = bpy.context.sequences
519  row = layout.row()
520  row.operator('vseqf.quicklist_select', text='Select/Deselect All Clips').clip = ''
521  row = layout.row(align=True)
522  row.alignment = 'EXPAND'
523  row.label('Sort By:')
524  sub = row.column(align=True)
525  sub.operator('vseqf.quicklist_sortby', text='Position').method = 'Position'
526  if (scene.quicklistsort == 'Position'):
527  sub.active = True
528  else:
529  sub.active = False
530  sub = row.column(align=True)
531  sub.operator('vseqf.quicklist_sortby', text='Title').method = 'Title'
532  if (scene.quicklistsort == 'Title'):
533  sub.active = True
534  else:
535  sub.active = False
536  sub = row.column(align=True)
537  sub.operator('vseqf.quicklist_sortby', text='Length').method = 'Length'
538  if (scene.quicklistsort == 'Length'):
539  sub.active = True
540  else:
541  sub.active = False
542  sorted = list(sequences)
543  if (scene.quicklistsort == 'Title'):
544  sorted.sort(key=lambda sequence: sequence.name)
545  elif (scene.quicklistsort =='Length'):
546  sorted.sort(key=lambda sequence: sequence.frame_final_duration)
547  else:
548  sorted.sort(key=lambda sequence: sequence.frame_final_start)
549  for clip in sorted:
550  if (hasattr(clip, 'input_1')):
551  resort = sorted.pop(sorted.index(clip))
552  parentindex = sorted.index(clip.input_1)
553  sorted.insert(parentindex + 1, resort)
554  for index, sequence in enumerate(sorted):
555  if (hasattr(sequence, 'input_1')):
556  row = layout.row()
557  row.separator()
558  row.separator()
559  outline = row.box()
560  else:
561  outline = layout.box()
562  box = outline.column()
563  row = box.row(align=True)
564  split = row.split(align=True)
565  split.prop(sequence, 'mute', text='')
566  split.prop(sequence, 'lock', text='')
567  split = row.split(align=True, percentage=0.2)
568  col = split.column(align=True)
569  col.operator('vseqf.quicklist_select', text="("+sequence.type+")").clip = sequence.name
570  col.active = sequence.select
571  col = split.column(align=True)
572  col.prop(sequence, 'name', text='')
573  row = box.row()
574  split = row.split(percentage=0.8)
575  col = split.row(align=True)
576  col.prop(sequence, 'frame_final_duration', text="Length: ("+timecode_from_frames(sequence.frame_final_duration, scene.render.fps)+"), Frame")
577  col.prop(sequence, 'frame_start', text="Position: ("+timecode_from_frames(sequence.frame_start, scene.render.fps)+"), Frame")
578  col = split.row()
579  if (sequence.type != 'SOUND'):
580  col.prop(sequence, 'use_proxy', text='Proxy')
581  if (sequence.use_proxy):
582  row = box.row()
583  split = row.split(percentage=0.33)
584  col = split.row(align=True)
585  col.prop(sequence.proxy, 'quality')
586  col = split.row(align=True)
587  col.prop(sequence.proxy, 'build_25')
588  col.prop(sequence.proxy, 'build_50')
589  col.prop(sequence.proxy, 'build_75')
590  col.prop(sequence.proxy, 'build_100')
591  children = find_children(sequence)
592  if (len(children) > 0):
593  row = box.row()
594  split = row.split(percentage=0.25)
595  col = split.column()
596  col.label('Children:')
597  col = split.column()
598  for child in children:
599  col.label(child)
600  if (sequence.type == 'META'):
601  row = box.row()
602  split = row.split(percentage=0.25)
603  col = split.column()
604  col.label('Subclips:')
605  col = split.column()
606  for subclip in sequence.sequences:
607  col.label(subclip.name)
608

619 class VSEQFQuickListSelect(bpy.types.Operator):
620  bl_idname = "vseqf.quicklist_select"
621  bl_label = "VSEQF Quick List Select Clip"
622  clip = bpy.props.StringProperty()
623  def execute(self, context):
624  sequences = context.sequences
625  if (self.clip == ''):
626  bpy.ops.sequencer.select_all(action='TOGGLE')
627  else:
628  for sequence in sequences:
629  if (sequence.name == self.clip):
630  sequence.select = not sequence.select
631  return {'FINISHED'}

634 #Classes related to continuous update
635 class VSEQFContinuousMenu(bpy.types.Menu):
636  bl_idname = "vseqf.continuous_menu"
637  bl_label = "Continuous Settings"
638  def draw(self, context):
639  layout = self.layout
640  scene = bpy.context.scene
641  layout.prop(scene, 'quickcontinuousenable')
642  if (scene.quickcontinuousenable):
643  layout.separator()
644  layout.prop(scene, 'quickcontinuousfollow')
645  layout.prop(scene, 'quickcontinuoussnap')
646  layout.prop(scene, 'quickcontinuoussnapdistance')
647  layout.prop(scene, 'quickcontinuouschildren')
648 
649 class VSEQFContinuous(bpy.types.Operator):
650  bl_idname = "vseqf.continuous"
651  bl_label = "VSEQF Continuous Modal Operator"
652  lastScene = bpy.props.StringProperty()
653  lastClip = bpy.props.StringProperty()
654  lastClipStart = bpy.props.IntProperty()
655  lastClipLength = bpy.props.IntProperty()
656  lastClipChannel = bpy.props.IntProperty()
657  lastCursor = bpy.props.IntProperty()
658  lastNumberOfClips = bpy.props.IntProperty()
659  def set_old_variables(self):
660  scene = bpy.context.scene
661  sequencer = scene.sequence_editor
662  sequences = bpy.context.sequences
663  if (hasattr(sequencer, 'active_strip')):
664  clip = sequencer.active_strip
665  else:
666  clip = None
667  self.lastScene = scene.name
668  if (hasattr(clip, 'name')):
669  self.lastClip = clip.name
670  self.lastClipStart = clip.frame_final_start
671  self.lastClipLength = clip.frame_final_duration
672  self.lastClipChannel = clip.channel
673  self.lastNumberOfClips = len(sequencer.sequences_all)
674  else:
675  self.lastClip = 'None'
676  self.lastClipStart = 0
677  self.lastClipLength = 0
678  self.lastClipChannel = 0
679  self.lastNumberOfClips = 0
680  self.lastCursor = scene.frame_current
681  def modal(self, context, event):
682  scene = context.scene
683  if (scene.quickcontinuousenable):
684  if (self.lastScene == scene.name):
685  if (self.lastClip != 'None'):
686  sequencer = scene.sequence_editor
687  sequences = bpy.context.sequences
688  clip = sequencer.active_strip
689  if (clip.name == self.lastClip):
690  if ((clip.frame_final_start != self.lastClipStart) & (clip.frame_final_duration == self.lastClipLength)):
691  if (scene.quickcontinuoussnap):
692  nextclip = find_next_clip(sequences, clip, mode='channel')
693  previousclip = find_previous_clip(sequences, clip, mode='channel')
694  try:
695  nextdistance = nextclip.frame_final_start - clip.frame_final_end
696  except:
697  nextdistance = scene.quickcontinuoussnapdistance + 1
698  try:
699  previousdistance = clip.frame_final_start - previousclip.frame_final_end
700  except:
701  previousdistance = scene.quickcontinuoussnapdistance + 1
702  snapclip = min([[nextdistance, 'next'], [previousdistance, 'previous']])
703  if (snapclip[0] <= scene.quickcontinuoussnapdistance):
704  if (snapclip[1] == 'next'):
705  clip.frame_start = clip.frame_start + nextdistance
706  else:
707  clip.frame_start = clip.frame_start - previousdistance
708  if (scene.quickcontinuouschildren):
709  childrennames = find_children(clip)
710  if (childrennames):
711  offset = clip.frame_final_start - self.lastClipStart
712  for childname in childrennames:
713  for sequence in sequences:
714  if (sequence.name == childname):
715  sequence.frame_start = sequence.frame_start + offset
716  elif (clip.frame_final_duration != self.lastClipLength):
717  if ((clip.frame_final_start == self.lastClipStart) & (len(sequencer.sequences_all) == self.lastNumberOfClips + 1)):
718  #clip was cut because beginning point is the same, duration is different, and total clips are increased by one
719  if (scene.quickcontinuouschildren):
720  childrennames = find_children(clip)
721  if (childrennames):
722  cutchildren = []
723  #unfortunately, cutting doesnt always select both parts of the cut...
724  #and there seems to be no way of finding the second part
725  #so if the cut parent isnt selected, the children arent copied over
726  cutparent = bpy.context.selected_sequences[0]
727  if ((cutparent.name == clip.name) | (cutparent.name.split('.')[0] != clip.name.split('.')[0])):
728  cutparent = False
729  for childname in childrennames:
730  for child in sequences:
731  if (child.name == childname):
732  if ((child.frame_final_start < scene.frame_current) & (child.frame_final_end > scene.frame_current)):
733  bpy.ops.sequencer.select_all(action='DESELECT')
734  child.select = True
735  bpy.ops.sequencer.cut(frame=scene.frame_current)
736  selected = bpy.context.selected_sequences
737  selected.remove(child)
738  cutchildren.extend(selected)
739  bpy.ops.sequencer.select_all(action='DESELECT')
740  if (cutparent):
741  cutparent.select = True
742  sequencer.active_strip = cutparent
743  add_children(cutparent, cutchildren)
744  self.report({'INFO'}, "Duplicated child cut clips to cut parent")
745  #report doesnt work so we have to fall back to print, lame
746  print("Duplicated child cut clips to cut parent")
747  else:
748  self.report({'WARNING'}, "Could not determine cut parent clip")
749  print("Could not determine cut parent clip")
750  else:
751  #clip was resized
752  pass
753  else:
754  if (len(sequencer.sequences_all) > self.lastNumberOfClips):
755  #clip was added
756  selected = bpy.context.selected_sequences
757  if (len(selected) > 1):
758  for clip in selected:
759  if (clip.type == 'MOVIE'):
760  soundclip = find_sound_clip(clip.name, selected)
761  if (soundclip):
762  self.report({'INFO'}, "Parenting "+soundclip.name+" to "+clip.name)
763  add_children(clip, [soundclip])
764  if (scene.frame_current != self.lastCursor):
765  if (scene.quickcontinuousfollow):
766  #move timeline to follow cursor
767  for area in bpy.context.screen.areas:
768  if (area.type == 'SEQUENCE_EDITOR'):
769  for region in area.regions:
770  if (region.type == 'WINDOW'):
771  if (area.spaces[0].view_type == 'SEQUENCER'):
772  override = {'area': area, 'window': bpy.context.window, 'region': region, 'screen': bpy.context.screen}
773  offset = scene.frame_current - self.lastCursor
774  bpy.ops.view2d.pan(override, deltax=offset)
775  self.set_old_variables()
776  return {'PASS_THROUGH'}
777  else:
778  return {'FINISHED'}
779  def invoke(self, context, event):
780  if (context.scene.quickcontinuousenable):
781  self.set_old_variables()
782  context.window_manager.modal_handler_add(self)
783  return {'RUNNING_MODAL'}
784  else:
785  return {'CANCELLED'}
786

842  row = outline.row()
843  row.prop(scene, 'quicktitlershadowsize', text='Distance')
844  row.prop(scene, 'quicktitlershadowsoft', text='Soft')

860 class VSEQFQuickTitling(bpy.types.Operator):
861  bl_idname = 'vseqf.quicktitling'
862  bl_label = 'VSEQF Quick Titling'
863  bl_description = 'Creates or updates a titler scene'
864  action = bpy.props.StringProperty()
865  def execute(self, context):
866  scene = titling_scene()
867  sequencer = bpy.context.scene.sequence_editor
868  if (self.action == 'create'):
869  bpy.ops.scene.new(type='EMPTY')
870  titleScene = bpy.context.scene
871  titleScene.quicktitlerfont = scene.quicktitlerfont
872  titleScene.quicktitlerx = scene.quicktitlerx
873  titleScene.quicktitlery = scene.quicktitlery
874  titleScene.quicktitlersize = scene.quicktitlersize
875  titleScene.quicktitlerextrude = scene.quicktitlerextrude
876  titleScene.quicktitlerbevelsize = scene.quicktitlerbevelsize
877  titleScene.quicktitlerbevelresolution = scene.quicktitlerbevelresolution
878  titleScene.quicktitlertext = scene.quicktitlertext
879  titleScene.quicktitlerlength = scene.quicktitlerlength
880  titleScene.name = "QuickTitle: "+titleScene.quicktitlertext
881  titleScene.frame_end = titleScene.quicktitlerlength
882  titleScene.layers = [True, True, True, True, True, True, True, True, True, True, True, True, True, True, True, True, True, True, True, True]
883  bpy.ops.object.camera_add()
884  camera = bpy.context.scene.objects.active
885  titleScene.camera = camera
886  camera.location = ((0, 0, 15))
887  camera.name = "QuickTitlerCamera"
888  lampEnergy = 0.5
889  bpy.ops.object.lamp_add(location=(-4, -2.5, 2))
890  lamp1 = bpy.context.scene.objects.active
891  lamp1.data.energy = lampEnergy
892  lamp1.data.shadow_method = 'NOSHADOW'
893  bpy.ops.object.lamp_add(location=(4, -2.5, 2))
894  lamp2 = bpy.context.scene.objects.active
895  lamp2.data.energy = lampEnergy
896  lamp2.data.shadow_method = 'NOSHADOW'
897  bpy.ops.object.lamp_add(location=(-4, 2.5, 2))
898  lamp3 = bpy.context.scene.objects.active
899  lamp3.data.energy = lampEnergy
900  lamp3.data.shadow_method = 'NOSHADOW'
901  bpy.ops.object.lamp_add(location=(4, 2.5, 2))
902  lamp4 = bpy.context.scene.objects.active
903  lamp4.data.energy = lampEnergy
904  lamp4.data.shadow_method = 'NOSHADOW'
905  bpy.ops.object.lamp_add(type= 'SPOT', location=(0, 0, 4))
906  shadowLamp = bpy.context.scene.objects.active
907  shadowLamp.name = 'QuickTitlerLamp'
908  shadowLamp.data.use_only_shadow = True
909  shadowLamp.data.shadow_method = 'BUFFER_SHADOW'
910  shadowLamp.data.shadow_buffer_type = 'REGULAR'
911  shadowLamp.data.shadow_buffer_soft = 10
912  shadowLamp.data.shadow_buffer_bias = 0.1
913  shadowLamp.data.shadow_buffer_size = 512
914  shadowLamp.data.shadow_buffer_samples = 8
915  shadowLamp.data.spot_size = 2.182
916  bpy.ops.object.text_add()
917  text = bpy.context.scene.objects.active
918  text.data.align = 'CENTER'
919  text.name = "QuickTitlerText"
920  bpy.ops.mesh.primitive_plane_add(radius=10)
921  shadow = bpy.context.scene.objects.active
922  shadow.name = "QuickTitlerShadow"
923  shadow.draw_type = 'WIRE'
924  shadowMaterial = bpy.data.materials.new('QuickTitlerShadow')
925  shadowMaterial.diffuse_color = (0, 0, 0)
926  shadowMaterial.diffuse_intensity = 1
927  shadowMaterial.specular_intensity = 0
928  shadowMaterial.use_transparency = True
929  shadowMaterial.use_cast_buffer_shadows = False
930  shadowMaterial.shadow_only_type = 'SHADOW_ONLY'
931  shadowMaterial.use_only_shadow = True
932  shadow.data.materials.append(shadowMaterial)
933  titleScene.render.engine = 'BLENDER_RENDER'
934  titleScene.render.alpha_mode = 'TRANSPARENT'
935  titleScene.render.image_settings.file_format = 'PNG'
936  titleScene.render.image_settings.color_mode = 'RGBA'
937  bpy.context.screen.scene = scene
938  bpy.ops.sequencer.scene_strip_add(frame_start=scene.frame_current, scene=titleScene.name)
939  sequence = sequencer.active_strip
940  sequence.blend_type = 'ALPHA_OVER'
941  scene = titleScene
942  else:
943  sequence = bpy.context.scene.sequence_editor.active_strip
944  text = None
945  shadow = None
946  shadowLamp = None
947  for object in scene.objects:
948  if (object.type == 'FONT'):
949  text = object
950  if ("QuickTitlerShadow" in object.name):
951  shadow = object
952  if ("QuickTitlerLamp" in object.name):
953  shadowLamp = object
954  if ((text == None) or (shadow == None) or (shadowLamp == None)):
955  self.report({'WARNING'}, 'Selected Title Scene Is Incomplete')
956  return {'CANCELLED'}
957  scene.frame_end = scene.quicktitlerlength
958  index = bpy.data.materials.find(scene.quicktitlermaterial)
959  if (index >= 0):
960  text.data.materials.clear()
961  text.data.materials.append(bpy.data.materials[index])
962  else:
963  material = bpy.data.materials.new('QuickTitler Material')
964  scene.quicktitlermaterial = material.name
965  text.location = (scene.quicktitlerx, scene.quicktitlery, 0)
966  text.scale = (scene.quicktitlersize, scene.quicktitlersize, scene.quicktitlersize)
967  text.data.extrude = scene.quicktitlerextrude
968  text.data.bevel_depth = scene.quicktitlerbevelsize
969  text.data.bevel_resolution = scene.quicktitlerbevelresolution
970  text.data.body = scene.quicktitlertext
971  text.data.font = bpy.data.fonts[scene.quicktitlerfont]
972  shadow.material_slots[0].material.alpha = scene.quicktitlershadow
973  shadowLamp.data.shadow_buffer_soft = scene.quicktitlershadowsoft * 10
974  shadow.location = (0, 0, -(scene.quicktitlershadowsize / 8))
975  scene.name = "QuickTitle: "+scene.quicktitlertext
976  sequence.name = "QuickTitle: "+scene.quicktitlertext
977  bpy.ops.sequencer.reload(adjust_length=True)
978  bpy.ops.sequencer.refresh_all()
979  return {'FINISHED'}

1023 class VSEQFQuickParentsPanel(bpy.types.Panel):
1024  bl_label = "Quick Parents"
1025  bl_space_type = 'SEQUENCE_EDITOR'
1026  bl_region_type = 'UI'
1027  @classmethod
1028  def poll(self, context):
1029  try:
1030  sequence = context.scene.sequence_editor.active_strip
1031  if (sequence):
1032  return True
1033  else:
1034  return False
1035  except:
1036  return False
1037  def draw(self, context):
1038  scene = bpy.context.scene
1039  strip = scene.sequence_editor.active_strip
1040  selected = bpy.context.selected_sequences
1041  childrennames = find_children(strip.name)
1042  parentname = find_parent(strip.name)
1043  layout = self.layout
1044  row = layout.row()
1045  row.operator('vseqf.quickparents', text='Select Children').action = 'selectchildren'
1046  row = layout.row()
1047  if (len(selected) <= 1):
1048  row.enabled = False
1049  row.operator('vseqf.quickparents', text='Set Active As Parent').action = 'add'
1050  row = layout.row()
1051  row.operator('vseqf.quickparents', text='Clear Parent').action = 'clearparent'
1052  row.operator('vseqf.quickparents', text='Clear Children').action = 'clearchildren'
1053  if (parentname != 'None'):
1054  row = layout.row()
1055  row.label("Parent: "+parentname)
1056  if (len(childrennames) > 0):
1057  row = layout.row()
1058  row.label("Children: "+childrennames[0])
1059  index = 1
1060  while index < len(childrennames):
1061  row = layout.row()
1062  row.label(childrennames[index])
1063  index = index + 1
1064 
1065 class VSEQFQuickParentsMenu(bpy.types.Menu):
1066  bl_idname = "vseqf.quickparents_menu"
1067  bl_label = "Quick Parents"
1068  def draw(self, context):
1069  scene = bpy.context.scene
1070  strip = scene.sequence_editor.active_strip
1071  layout = self.layout
1072  if (strip):
1073  selected = bpy.context.selected_sequences
1074  childrennames = find_children(strip.name)
1075  parentname = find_parent(strip.name)
1076  layout.operator('vseqf.quickparents', text='Select Children').action = 'selectchildren'
1077  if (len(selected) > 1):
1078  layout.operator('vseqf.quickparents', text='Set Active As Parent').action = 'add'
1079  layout.operator('vseqf.quickparents', text='Clear Parent').action = 'clearparent'
1080  layout.operator('vseqf.quickparents', text='Clear Children').action = 'clearchildren'
1081  layout.separator()
1082  if (parentname != 'None'):
1083  layout.label(" Parent: ")
1084  layout.label(parentname)
1085  layout.separator()
1086  if (len(childrennames) > 0):
1087  layout.label(" Children:")
1088  index = 0
1089  while index < len(childrennames):
1090  layout.label(childrennames[index])
1091  index = index + 1
1092  layout.separator()
1093  else:
1094  layout.label('No Strip Selected')

1096 class VSEQFQuickParents(bpy.types.Operator):
1097  bl_idname = 'vseqf.quickparents'
1098  bl_label = 'VSEQF Quick Parents'
1099  bl_description = 'Sets Or Removes Strip Parents'
1100  action = bpy.props.StringProperty()
1101  def execute(self, context):
1102  clean_relationships()
1103  selected = bpy.context.selected_sequences
1104  active = bpy.context.scene.sequence_editor.active_strip
1105  if (self.action == 'add'):
1106  if (len(selected) > 1):
1107  add_children(active, selected)
1108  for clip in selected:
1109  if (self.action == 'selectchildren'):
1110  select_children(clip.name)
1111  if (self.action == 'clearparent'):
1112  clear_parent(clip.name)
1113  if (self.action == 'clearchildren'):
1114  clear_children(clip.name)
1115  return {'FINISHED'}

1118 #Classes related to QuickSnaps
1119 class VSEQFQuickSnapsMenu(bpy.types.Menu):
1120  bl_idname = "vseqf.quicksnaps_menu"
1121  bl_label = "Quick Snaps"
1122  def draw(self, context):
1123  layout = self.layout
1124  layout.operator('vseqf.quicksnaps', text='Cursor To Nearest Second').type = 'cursor_to_seconds'
1125  scene = bpy.context.scene
1126  try:
1127  strip = scene.sequence_editor.active_strip
1128  if (strip):
1129  layout.operator('vseqf.quicksnaps', text='Cursor To Beginning Of Clip').type = 'cursor_to_beginning'
1130  layout.operator('vseqf.quicksnaps', text='Cursor To End Of Clip').type = 'cursor_to_end'
1131  layout.separator()
1132  layout.operator('vseqf.quicksnaps', text='Clip Beginning To Cursor').type = 'begin_to_cursor'
1133  layout.operator('vseqf.quicksnaps', text='Clip End To Cursor').type = 'end_to_cursor'
1134  layout.operator('vseqf.quicksnaps', text='Clip To Previous Clip').type = 'clip_to_previous'
1135  layout.operator('vseqf.quicksnaps', text='Clip To Next Clip').type = 'clip_to_next'
1136  except:
1137  pass
1138 
1139 class VSEQFQuickSnaps(bpy.types.Operator):
1140  bl_idname = 'vseqf.quicksnaps'
1141  bl_label = 'VSEQF Quick Snaps'
1142  bl_description = 'Snaps selected sequencer clips'
1143  type = bpy.props.StringProperty()
1144  def execute(self, context):
1145  selected = bpy.context.selected_sequences
1146  scene = bpy.context.scene
1147  active = bpy.context.scene.sequence_editor.active_strip
1148  frame = scene.frame_current
1149  if (self.type == 'cursor_to_seconds'):
1150  fps = scene.render.fps / scene.render.fps_base
1151  scene.frame_current = round(round(scene.frame_current / fps) * fps)
1152  if (self.type == 'cursor_to_beginning'):
1153  scene.frame_current = active.frame_final_start
1154  if (self.type == 'cursor_to_end'):
1155  scene.frame_current = active.frame_final_end
1156  if (self.type == 'begin_to_cursor'):
1157  for clip in selected:
1158  offset = clip.frame_final_start - clip.frame_start
1159  clip.frame_start = (frame - offset)
1160  if (self.type == 'end_to_cursor'):
1161  for clip in selected:
1162  offset = clip.frame_final_start - clip.frame_start
1163  clip.frame_start = (frame - offset - clip.frame_final_duration)
1164  if (self.type == 'clip_to_previous'):
1165  previous = find_previous_clip(scene.sequence_editor.sequences, active, 'any')
1166  if (previous):
1167  for clip in selected:
1168  offset = clip.frame_final_start - clip.frame_start
1169  clip.frame_start = (previous.frame_final_end - offset)
1170  else:
1171  self.report({'WARNING'}, 'No Previous Clip Found')
1172  if (self.type == 'clip_to_next'):
1173  next = find_next_clip(scene.sequence_editor.sequences, active, 'any')
1174  if (next):
1175  for clip in selected:
1176  offset = clip.frame_final_start - clip.frame_start
1177  clip.frame_start = (next.frame_final_start - offset - clip.frame_final_duration)
1178  else:
1179  self.report({'WARNING'}, 'No Next Clip Found')
1180  return{'FINISHED'}

1183 #Classes related to QuickFades
1184 class VSEQFQuickFadesPanel(bpy.types.Panel):
1185  bl_label = "Quick Fades"
1186  bl_space_type = 'SEQUENCE_EDITOR'
1187  bl_region_type = 'UI'
1188  @classmethod
1189  def poll(self, context):
1190  try:
1191  sequence = context.scene.sequence_editor.active_strip
1192  if (sequence):
1193  return True
1194  else:
1195  return False
1196  except:
1197  return False
1198  def draw(self, context):
1199  scene = bpy.context.scene
1200  strip = scene.sequence_editor.active_strip
1201  frame = scene.frame_current
1202  sequenceEditor = bpy.context.area.spaces.active
1203  layout = self.layout
1204  row = layout.row()
1205  fadein = fades(strip=strip, fade=0, type='in', mode='detect')
1206  fadeout = fades(strip=strip, fade=0, type='out', mode='detect')
1207  if (fadein > 0):
1208  row.label("Fadein: "+str(round(fadein))+" Frames")
1209  else:
1210  row.label("No Fadein Detected")
1211  if (fadeout > 0):
1212  row.label("Fadeout: "+str(round(fadeout))+" Frames")
1213  else:
1214  row.label("No Fadeout Detected")
1215  row = layout.row()
1216  row.prop(scene, 'fade')
1217  row = layout.row()
1218  row.operator('vseqf.quickfades', text='Set Fadein').type = 'in'
1219  row.operator('vseqf.quickfades', text='Set Fadeout').type = 'out'
1220  row = layout.row()
1221  row.operator('vseqf.quickfades_clear', text='Clear Fades')
1222  row = layout.row()
1223  row.separator()
1224  row = layout.row()
1225  row.menu('vseqf.quickfades_transition_menu', text="Transition Type: "+scene.transition)
1226  row = layout.row()
1227  row.operator('vseqf.quickfades_cross', text='Crossfade Prev Clip').type = 'previous'
1228  row.operator('vseqf.quickfades_cross', text='Crossfade Next Clip').type = 'next'
1229  row = layout.row()
1230  row.operator('vseqf.quickfades_cross', text='Smart Cross to Prev').type = 'previoussmart'
1231  row.operator('vseqf.quickfades_cross', text='Smart Cross to Next').type = 'nextsmart'

1288 class VSEQFQuickFadesCross(bpy.types.Operator):
1289  bl_idname = 'vseqf.quickfades_cross'
1290  bl_label = 'VSEQF Quick Fades Add Crossfade'
1291  bl_description = 'Adds a crossfade between selected strip and next or previous strip in timeline if they overlap'
1292  type = bpy.props.StringProperty()
1293  def execute(self, context):
1294  sequences = bpy.context.sequences
1295  #store a list of selected sequences since adding a crossfade destroys the selection
1296  selectedSequences = bpy.context.selected_sequences
1297  #iterate through selected sequences and add crossfades to previous or next clip
1298  for sequence in selectedSequences:
1299  if (self.type == 'nextsmart'):
1300  firstClip = sequence
1301  secondClip = find_next_clip(sequences, firstClip, mode='all')
1302  if (self.type == 'previoussmart'):
1303  secondClip = sequence
1304  firstClip = find_previous_clip(sequences, secondClip, mode='all')
1305  if (self.type == 'next'):
1306  firstClip = sequence
1307  secondClip = find_next_clip(sequences, firstClip)
1308  elif (self.type == 'previous'):
1309  secondClip = sequence
1310  firstClip = find_previous_clip(sequences, secondClip)
1311  if ((secondClip != False) & (firstClip != False)):
1312  if ('smart' in self.type):
1313  #adjust start and end frames of clips based on frame_offset_end/start to overlap by amount of crossfade
1314  targetFade = bpy.context.scene.fade
1315  currentFade = firstClip.frame_final_end - secondClip.frame_final_start
1316  fadeOffset = abs(currentFade - targetFade)
1317  firstOffset = round((fadeOffset/2)+.1)
1318  secondOffset = round((fadeOffset/2)-.1)
1319  firstClip.frame_final_end
1320  secondClip.frame_final_start
1321  if (currentFade < targetFade):
1322  #extend frame end and start based on how much offset
1323  if (((firstClip.frame_offset_end > firstOffset) & (secondClip.frame_offset_start > secondOffset)) | ((firstClip.frame_offset_end == 0) & (secondClip.frame_offset_start == 0))):
1324  #both clip offsets are larger than both target offsets or neither clip has offsets
1325  firstClip.frame_final_end = firstClip.frame_final_end + firstOffset
1326  secondClip.frame_final_start = secondClip.frame_final_start - secondOffset
1327  else:
1328  #clip offsets need to be adjusted individually
1329  currentOffset = firstClip.frame_offset_end + secondClip.frame_offset_start
1330  firstOffsetPercent = firstClip.frame_offset_end / currentOffset
1331  secondOffsetPercent = secondClip.frame_offset_start / currentOffset
1332  firstClip.frame_final_end = firstClip.frame_final_end + (round(firstOffsetPercent * fadeOffset))
1333  secondClip.frame_final_start = secondClip.frame_final_start - (round(secondOffsetPercent * fadeOffset))
1334  elif (currentFade > targetFade):
1335  #overlap is larger than target fade, subtract equal amounts from each clip
1336  firstClip.frame_final_end = firstClip.frame_final_end - firstOffset
1337  secondClip.frame_final_start = secondClip.frame_final_start + secondOffset
1338  crossfade(firstClip, secondClip)
1339  else:
1340  self.report({'WARNING'}, 'No Second Clip Found')
1341  return{'FINISHED'}
1342

1499  keymapparentselect.properties.action = 'selectchildren'

1502  for handler in handlers:
1503  if (" frame_step " in str(handler)):
1504  handlers.remove(handler)
1505  handlers.append(frame_step)
1506  handlers = bpy.app.handlers.load_post
1507  for handler in handlers:
1508  if (" toggle_continuous " in str(handler)):
1509  handlers.remove(handler)
1510  handlers.append(toggle_continuous)

1513  bpy.types.SEQUENCER_HT_header.remove(draw_quickspeed_header)
1514  bpy.types.SEQUENCER_MT_view.remove(draw_quickzoom_menu)
1515  bpy.types.SEQUENCER_MT_view.remove(draw_quickcontinuous_menu)
1516  bpy.types.SEQUENCER_MT_strip.remove(draw_quicksnap_menu)
1517  del bpy.types.Scene.step
1518  del bpy.types.Scene.quicklistsort
1519  keymapitems = bpy.context.window_manager.keyconfigs.addon.keymaps['Sequencer'].keymap_items
1520  for keymapitem in keymapitems:
1521  if ((keymapitem.type == 'Z') | (keymapitem.type == 'F') | (keymapitem.type == 'S')):
1522  keymapitems.remove(keymapitem)
1523  handlers = bpy.app.handlers.frame_change_post
1524  for handler in handlers:
1525  if (" frame_step " in str(handler)):
1526  handlers.remove(handler)
1527  handlers = bpy.app.handlers.load_post
1528  for handler in handlers:
1529  if (" toggle_continuous " in str(handler)):
1530  handlers.remove(handler)
